p: The phytochemical study of the ethanolic extract of C. articulatus obtained from residues derived from the extraction of essential oil resulted in the identification of the following main compounds: alpha-bulnesene, cadalene, cyperotundone, cis-thujopsenal, cyclocolorenone, corymbolone, hexadecanoic acid ethyl ester, 9,12-octadecanoic acid ethyl ester, 9-octadecenoic acid ethyl ester, and cholesta-3,5-diene. Together, these compounds represented more than 60% of the total sample ( Table 1).
